text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to identify that to recover for reputational damages, the Germans must prove three specific elements: (1) the security vulnerability existed at the time of the contract, (2) the vulnerability caused a loss to the distributor, and (3) the termination of the agreement was necessary. The candidate answer discusses reputational damage claims in Section 3 (Legal Framework) and Section 5.1 (Substantive Arbitration Strategy) but only frames it in terms of whether the claim falls within the arbitration clause or what Delaware law governs breach/damages.
